info.title: OverFast API
info.description:
OverFast API provides comprehensive data on Overwatch 2 heroes,
game modes, maps, and player statistics by scraping Blizzard pages. Developed with
the efficiency of **FastAPI** and **Beautiful Soup**, it leverages **nginx** as a
reverse proxy and **Redis** for caching. Its tailored caching mechanism significantly
reduces calls to Blizzard pages, ensuring swift and precise data delivery to users.

This live instance is restricted to **30 req/s** (a shared limit across all endpoints).
If you require more, consider hosting your own instance on a server üëç

In player career statistics, various conversions are applied for ease of use:
- **Duration values** are converted to **seconds** (integer)
- **Percent values** are represented as **integers**, omitting the percent symbol
- Integer and float string representations are converted to their respective types

Swagger UI (useful for trying API calls) : http://localhost:8000/docs

get.description:
Get a list of Overwatch heroes, which can be filtered using roles.
**Cache TTL : 1 day.**

Get data about an Overwatch hero : description, abilities, story, etc.
**Cache TTL : 1 day.**

Get a list of available Overwatch roles.
**Cache TTL : 1 day.**

Get a list of Overwatch gamemodes : Assault, Escort, Flashpoint, Hybrid, etc.
**Cache TTL : 1 day.**

Get a list of Overwatch maps : Hanamura, King's Row, Dorado, etc.
**Cache TTL : 1 day.**

parameters.name: gamemode

schema.title: Gamemode filter
schema.description: Filter maps available for a specific gamemode

parameters.description: Filter maps available for a specific gamemode

get.description:
Search for a given player by using his username. You should be able to find the associated player_id to use in order to request career data.
**Cache TTL : 1 hour.**

schema.title: Ordering field and the way it's arranged (asc[ending]/desc[ending])

get.description:
Get player summary : name, avatar, competitive ranks, etc.
**Cache TTL : 1 hour.**

parameters.name: player_id

schema.title: Player unique name
schema.description: Identifier of the player : BattleTag (with "#" replaced by "-"). Be careful, letter case (capital/non-capital letters) is important !

parameters.description: Identifier of the player : BattleTag (with "#" replaced by "-"). Be careful, letter case (capital/non-capital letters) is important !

get.description:
Get player statistics summary, with stats usually used for tracking progress : winrate, kda, damage, healing, etc.
Data is regrouped in 3 sections : general (sum of all stats), roles (sum of stats for each role) and heroes (stats for each hero).
Depending on filters, data from both competitive and quickplay, and/or pc and console will be merged.
Default behaviour : all gamemodes and platforms are taken in account.
**Cache TTL : 1 hour.**

parameters.name: player_id

schema.title: Player unique name
schema.description: Identifier of the player : BattleTag (with "#" replaced by "-"). Be careful, letter case (capital/non-capital letters) is important !

parameters.description: Identifier of the player : BattleTag (with "#" replaced by "-"). Be careful, letter case (capital/non-capital letters) is important !

parameters.name: gamemode

schema.title: Gamemode
schema.description: Filter on a specific gamemode. If not specified, the data of every gamemode will be combined.

parameters.description: Filter on a specific gamemode. If not specified, the data of every gamemode will be combined.

parameters.name: platform

schema.title: Platform
schema.description: Filter on a specific platform. If not specified, the data of every platform will be combined.

parameters.description: Filter on a specific platform. If not specified, the data of every platform will be combined.

get.description:
Career contains numerous statistics grouped by heroes and categories (combat, game, best, hero specific, average, etc.). Filter them on specific platform and gamemode (mandatory). You can even retrieve data about a specific hero of your choice.
**Cache TTL : 1 hour.**

parameters.name: player_id

schema.title: Player unique name
schema.description: Identifier of the player : BattleTag (with "#" replaced by "-"). Be careful, letter case (capital/non-capital letters) is important !

parameters.description: Identifier of the player : BattleTag (with "#" replaced by "-"). Be careful, letter case (capital/non-capital letters) is important !

parameters.name: platform

schema.title: Platform
schema.description: Filter on a specific platform. If not specified, the only platform the player played on will be selected. If the player has already played on both PC and console, the PC stats will be displayed by default.

parameters.description: Filter on a specific platform. If not specified, the only platform the player played on will be selected. If the player has already played on both PC and console, the PC stats will be displayed by default.

parameters.name: hero

schema.title: Hero key
schema.description: Filter on a specific hero in order to only get his statistics. You also can specify 'all-heroes' for general stats.

parameters.description: Filter on a specific hero in order to only get his statistics. You also can specify 'all-heroes' for general stats.

get.description:
This endpoint exposes the same data as the previous one, except it also exposes labels of the categories and statistics.
**Cache TTL : 1 hour.**

parameters.name: player_id

schema.title: Player unique name
schema.description: Identifier of the player : BattleTag (with "#" replaced by "-"). Be careful, letter case (capital/non-capital letters) is important !

schema.description: Filter on a specific platform. If not specified, the only platform the player played on will be selected. If the player has already played on both PC and console, the PC stats will be displayed by default.

Get all player data : summary and statistics with labels.
**Cache TTL : 1 hour.**

key.description: Key corresponding to the gamemode. Can be used as filter on the maps endpoint.

description.title: Description
examples: Teams battle to take control of a robot and push it toward the enemy base.

screenshot.title: Screenshot
screenshot.description: URL of an example screenshot of a map for the gamemode

description.title: Description
examples: Armed with his Peacekeeper revolver, Cassidy takes out targets with deadeye precision and dives out of danger with eagle-like speed.

portrait.title: Portrait
portrait.description: Portrait picture URL of the hero. On a hero release, can be null for a few days.

hitpoints.description: Hitpoints of the hero. Can be null if hero data isn't in the CSV.

stats.title: Stats
stats.description: List of statistics associated with the category

HeroKey.title: HeroKey
HeroKey.description: Hero keys used to identify Overwatch heroes in general

HeroKeyCareerFilter.title: HeroKeyCareerFilter
HeroKeyCareerFilter.description: Hero keys filter for career statistics endpoint

error.title: Error
error.description: Message describing the hero parser error
examples: Hero not found or not released yet

portrait.title: Portrait
portrait.description: Portrait picture URL of the hero

value.title: Value
value.description: Value of the statistic for the given hero. Duration values are in seconds.

time_played.description: Total time played for each hero (integer in seconds)

games_won.description: Number of games won for each hero (integer)

weapon_accuracy.description: Percentage of weapon accuracy for each hero (integer between 0 and 100)

win_percentage.description: Winrate percentage for each hero (integer between 0 and 100)

eliminations_per_life.description: Eliminations per life for each hero (float)

critical_hit_accuracy.description: Critical hit accuracy percentage for each hero (integer between 0 and 100)

multikill_best.description: Best multikills statistic for each hero (integer)

objective_kills.description: Total number of objective kills for each hero (integer)

values.title: Values
values.description: List of values of this statistic for each heroes. All heroes may not be included in the list.

error.title: Error
error.description: Message describing the internal server error
examples: An internal server error occurred during the process. The developer received a notification, but don't hesitate to create a GitHub issue if you want any news concerning the bug resolution : https://github.com/TeKrop/overfast-api/issues

gamemodes.title: Gamemodes
gamemodes.description: Main gamemodes on which the map is playable

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: Country Code of the location of the map. If not defined, it's null.

season.title: Season
season.description: Last competitive season played by the player. Can be 0 on Blizzard data for some reason, but can't explain what it means.

summary.description: Player summary (avatar, endorsement, competitive ranks, etc.)

stats.description: Player statistics (heroes comparisons, career stats, etc.). If the player career is private or has no stat at all, it's null.

all-heroes.description: Total of statistics for all heroes

tier.title: Tier
tier.description: Tier inside the division, lower is better

rank_icon.title: Rank Icon
rank_icon.description: URL of the division icon associated with the player rank

tier_icon.title: Tier Icon
tier_icon.description: URL of the tier icon associated with the player rank

pc.description: Competitive ranks for PC and last season played on it. If the player doesn't play on this platform, it's null.

console.description: Competitive ranks for console and last season played on it. If the player doesn't play on this platform, it's null.

level.title: Level
level.description: Player Endorsement level. 0 if no information found.

frame.title: Frame
frame.description: URL of the endorsement frame corresponding to the level

heroes_comparisons.description: List of general statistics on which heroes are compared for the player : total time played, number of games won, weapon accuracy, number of eliminations per life, etc.). Note that all heroes may not be included in every statistic objects.

career_stats.description: List of career statistics for every hero the player played : best statistics (most in game), combat (damage, kills, etc.), average (per 10 minutes), match awards (cards), hero specific, etc.)

error.title: Error
error.description: Message describing the player parser error

quickplay.description: Quickplay statistics about heroes. If the player doesn't have stats for this gamemode, it's null.

competitive.description: Competitive statistics about heroes in the last season played by the player. If the player doesn't have stats for this gamemode, it's null.

tank.description: Stats summary of all tank heroes played by the player. Not defined if he never played this role.

damage.description: Stats summary of all damage heroes played by the player. Not defined if he never played this role.

support.description: Stats summary of all support heroes played by the player. Not defined if he never played this role.

player_id.title: Player unique name
player_id.description: Identifier of the player : BattleTag (with "#" replaced by "-")

name.title: Name
name.description: Player nickname displayed in the game

avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.description: URL of the player's avatar. Can be null if couldn't retrieve any

namecard.title: Namecard
namecard.description: URL of the player's namecard (or banner) if any

title.title: Title
title.description: Title of the player if any

career_url.title: Career URL
career_url.description: Player's career OverFast API URL (Get player career data)

blizzard_id.title: Blizzard ID
blizzard_id.description: Blizzard unique identifier of the player (hexadecimal)

pc.description: Player statistics on PC. If the player doesn't play on this platform, it's null.

console.description: Player statistics on console. If the player doesn't play on this platform, it's null.

general.description: Sum of the stats of all the heroes played by the player

roles.description: Sum of the stats of all the heroes played by the player, regrouped by roles

heroes.description: Stats of all the heroes played by the player

avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.description: URL of the player's avatar. Can be null if couldn't retrieve any

namecard.title: Namecard
namecard.description: URL of the player's namecard (or banner) if any

title.title: Title
title.description: Title of the player if any

competitive.description: Competitive ranking in the last season played by the player in different roles depending on the platform. If the career is private or if the player doesn't play competitive at all, it's null.

description.title: Description
examples: Damage heroes seek out, engage, and obliterate the enemy with wide-ranging tools, abilities, and play styles. Fearsome but fragile, these heroes require backup to survive.

total.description: Total values for generic stats : eliminations, assists, deaths, damage, healing

average.description: Average values per 10 minutes for generic stats : eliminations, assists, deaths, damage, healing

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: Brief summary of the origin story of the hero
examples: A founding member of the notorious Deadlock Gang, Cassidy was eventually coerced into joining Blackwatch, Overwatch's covert-ops division. He came to believe he could make amends for his past by righting the world's injustices. But when Overwatch fell, Cassidy went underground, resurfacing later as a gunslinger for hire, fighting only for causes he believes are just.

media.description: Media concerning the hero (YouTube video, pdf story, etc.)

chapters.title: Chapters of the story
chapters.description: List of chapters concerning the story of the hero

content.title: Content
examples: Cassidy had already made a name for himself as a member of the notorious Deadlock Rebels Gang, when he and his associates were busted in an Overwatch sting operation. With his expert marksmanship and resourcefulness, he was given the choice between rotting in a maximum-security lockup and joining Blackwatch, Overwatch's covert ops division. He chose the latter. Although he was initially cynical, he came to believe that he could make amends for his past sins by righting the injustices of the world. Cassidy appreciated the flexibility afforded to the clandestine Blackwatch, unhindered by bureaucracy and red tape. But as Overwatch's influence waned, rogue elements within Blackwatch sought to bring down the organization and turn it to their own ends. After the destruction of Overwatch's Swiss HQ, Cassidy wanted no part of the infighting. He set off alone and went underground.

picture.title: Picture
picture.description: URL of the picture illustrating the chapter
